hero.title: Maximus
hero.subtitle: Cloud & Cybersecurity Infrastructure
hero.description: Architecting secure cloud solutions and protecting digital assets with resilient design, automated security pipelines, and enterprise-grade infrastructure.

about.bio: Hello! I'm Maximus, a passionate Cloud & Cybersecurity specialist based in Belgium. I thrive on tackling complex challenges and continuously expanding my knowledge in the ever-evolving tech landscape. My journey involves hands-on experience with cloud platforms like Azure and AWS, coupled with a strong interest in cybersecurity principles and practices.
about.educationText: Specialized education focused on Cloud Technologies and Cybersecurity, gaining expertise in network security, ethical hacking, cloud infrastructure management, and compliance.
about.ambitionsText: My goal is to become a proficient Cloud Security Engineer, helping organizations design, implement, and maintain secure and resilient cloud environments. I am eager to contribute to innovative projects and collaborate with like-minded professionals.
about.pageTitle: About Maximus Mukiza | Cloud Security Specialist
about.pageDescription: Learn more about Maximus Mukiza, a passionate cyber security professional with experience in IT support, cloud architecture, and security automation.
about.pageKeywords: Maximus Mukiza, cyber security, cloud security, AWS, Azure, portfolio, infrastructure engineer

projects.pageTitle: Projects - Maximus Mukiza | Cloud Security Portfolio
projects.pageDescription: Explore Maximus Mukiza's infrastructure projects, including packet automation, SIEM stack creation, Azure Bicep configurations, AWS hosting, and IoT security solutions.
projects.heading: My Projects
projects.intro: Here are some of the key projects I've worked on throughout my career. Each project represents unique challenges and valuable learning experiences in the field of cybersecurity and cloud computing.
projects.lightboxNav: Use arrow keys to navigate between projects, ESC to close

p1.title: Smart Parcel Locker System
p1.description: Collaborative project to develop an IoT-enabled package locker system with secure access control and centralized management.
p1.context: University-led team project simulating real-world IoT deployment in logistics security
p1.background: Addressed parcel theft risks through automated locker management with multi-factor authentication
p1.realizations: Enabled secure communication between ESP32 and Raspberry Pi, implementing error logging and security measures.
p1.learnings: Gained expertise in IoT device coordination, secure access token management, and embedded system security

p2.title: SOC-Integrated Hosting Platform
p2.description: Collaborative development of a SOC-integrated cloud hosting platform, focusing on log aggregation, monitoring, and incident response orchestration.
p2.context: Enterprise security monitoring initiative for distributed hosting environments.
p2.background: Researched and implemented centralized logging (Wazuh, Graylog) to enable real-time detection, forensic analysis, and client isolation.
p2.realizations: Integrated multi-tool security stack (Wazuh, MISP, Grafana, Shuffle) to establish an automated Security Operations Center framework.
p2.learnings: Advanced proficiency in SIEM architecture, threat intelligence integration, and automated incident response workflows.

projects.context: Second-semester team collaboration focused on enterprise security monitoring requirements for a simulated hosting platform within a datacenter environment.
projects.background: My role involved researching and implementing logging solutions (Wazuh, Graylog) to enable comprehensive monitoring, attack detection, and client isolation capabilities.
projects.realizations: Spearheaded the integration of logging and monitoring tools (Wazuh, Graylog, Grafana, MISP, OpenCTI, TheHive/Cortex, Velociraptor, Shuffle, InfluxDB/Telegraf), establishing a foundation for a near-complete Security Operations Center (SOC). Developed processes for identifying and isolating potentially compromised client instances.
projects.learnings: Gained hands-on experience with log aggregation, security monitoring, threat intelligence platforms, incident response workflows, and automation tools within a SOC context. Deepened understanding of SOC principles and tool integration.

p3.title: Bicep-Flex: Flask CRUD App Deployment on Azure
p3.description: Deployed a Flask CRUD application to Azure using Bicep, featuring ACR, ACI, Load Balancer, VNet with private/public subnets, and NSGs for security.
p3.context: Personal project demonstrating Infrastructure as Code (IaC) with Bicep for deploying containerized applications on Azure.
p3.background: Aimed to showcase secure deployment practices by placing the application in a private subnet and exposing it via a load balancer in a public subnet.
p3.realizations: Successfully automated the deployment of the entire stack (ACR, ACI, VNet, LB, NSGs) using Bicep. Implemented secure networking with private/public subnets and NSGs. Configured pull-only access token for ACR. Integrated Log Analytics for monitoring.
p3.learnings: Gained practical experience with Bicep for complex Azure deployments, containerization with Docker, ACR/ACI integration, Azure networking (VNet, Subnets, NSGs, Load Balancer), and secure credential management for ACR.

p4.title: AWS Secure Container Ecosystem
p4.description: Deployed a containerized Flask CRUD application on AWS using both EC2/Docker Compose and ECS, focusing on secure infrastructure setup and monitoring.
p4.context: Individual project exploring container deployment strategies and security practices within the AWS cloud environment.
p4.background: Investigated methods for deploying web applications using Docker on AWS, comparing direct EC2 deployment with ECS orchestration, including VPC configuration, security groups, and container registry usage.
p4.realizations: Successfully deployed the application via EC2 with Docker Compose and via ECS using an ECR image. Configured VPC with public/private subnets, Security Groups, NACLs, NAT/Internet Gateways. Set up ECR for image storage and ECS (Task Definition, Cluster, Service) for orchestration. Implemented basic monitoring using CloudWatch dashboards for CPU, memory, and logs.
p4.learnings: Gained hands-on experience with AWS services (VPC, EC2, ECR, ECS, CloudWatch), Docker containerization, Docker Compose, infrastructure setup for secure container deployment (networking, security groups), and cloud monitoring fundamentals.

p5.title: AI-Driven Smart Bridge Control System
p5.description: Intelligent IoT bridge control system implementing high-accuracy sound classification and computer vision for autonomous maritime traffic management.
p5.context: Infrastructure automation project focused on intelligent transportation systems and sensor fusion.
p5.background: Engineered multi-modal recognition system to optimize bridge operations and waterway navigation safety.
p5.realizations: Developed hybrid audio-visual recognition algorithms achieving 94% accuracy in real-world vessel classification.
p5.learnings: Expertise in digital signal processing, CNN-based vision systems, and edge-based decision logic.

p6.title: React-Sec-Ops: A Secure 3-Tier Application on AWS
p6.description: A full-stack, 3-tier web application deployed on AWS, demonstrating a modern, secure, and automated approach to cloud application deployment.
p6.context: Demonstration of diagnosing and adapting to real-world constraints of managed enterprise or educational cloud environments.
p6.background: Originally aimed for 100% automated deployment with OpenTofu, but adapted to a hybrid model due to IAM limitations in the AWS Learner Lab environment, requiring manual setup for CI/CD and CloudFront components.
p6.realizations: Successfully deployed a hybrid architecture with automated core infrastructure (VPC, ECS, RDS) via OpenTofu and manually configured CI/CD and CloudFront, documenting the constraints and workaround.
p6.learnings: Mastered Infrastructure as Code (IaC) with OpenTofu, designed a cloud-native 3-tier architecture, applied DevSecOps principles, and developed advanced problem-solving skills in response to environmental limitations.

cv.pageTitle: CV - Maximus Mukiza | Cloud & Cyber Security Specialist
cv.pageDescription: View the Curriculum Vitae of Maximus Mukiza, detailing education, work experience, skills, and certifications in IT and Cyber Security.
cv.heading: Curriculum Vitae
cv.name: Maximus Mukiza
cv.profileBio1: Focused Cloud & Cybersecurity professional specializing in Infrastructure as Code, security automation, and resilient cloud architecture.
cv.profileBio2: Combines hands-on experience with Azure, AWS, and SOC tools (Wazuh, Graylog) with a passion for building secure, automated cloud infrastructure.
cv.profileBio3: Dedicated to operational excellence and proactive security, implementing real-world solutions in distributed cloud environments.
cv.educationDegree1: Professional Bachelor, Cloud and Cyber Security
cv.educationUniversity1: Thomas More University of Applied Sciences
cv.work1Detail1: Developed 20+ personalized training plans; coached clients with a focus on safety and results.
cv.work1Detail2: Promoted and sold memberships — contributing to revenue growth.
cv.work1Detail3: First point of contact for questions: practiced clear, solution-oriented communication.
cv.work2Detail1: Processed and tracked ~800 delivery orders/week via Excel; improved data organization and reduced errors.
cv.work2Detail2: Supported customers via email and resolved service requests — strong focus on customer satisfaction.
cv.work2Detail3: Collaborated with logistics and sales: developed insight into business processes and data flow.
cv.work3Detail1: Redesigned the sales website: improved navigation and user experience (UX).
cv.work3Detail2: Created and edited product photos; ensured a consistent digital appearance.
cv.work3Detail3: Worked in a multidisciplinary team — strengthened communication and adaptability.
